node.title: Here we go again: Another wet, stormy trough on the way
node.description: A trough extending from the Great Australian Bight all the way to the tropics is set to bring another soggy few days and the chance of storms as it sweeps across the country.
node.content:
["A trough extending from\u00a0the Great Australian Bight to\u00a0the tropics is set to bring another soggy end to the week for central and eastern Australia.\u00a0", "Tropical moisture is streaming down from the north and is expected to bring\u00a0rain to South Australia, the Northern Territory, Tasmania, western\u00a0Victoria, western New South Wales and western Queensland today.", "Totals will be variable, but falls of 15 to 25 millimetres are expected for western Victoria and NSW.\u00a0", "But higher totals\u00a0of between 50mm and\u00a060mm are possible if you're under a thunderstorm or on a\u00a0north-facing aspect, according to Jackson Browne, senior meteorologist at the Bureau of Meteorology.\u00a0", "Storms are expected to be embedded within\u00a0the system, and while they could be severe, Mr Browne says they are likely to be a \"couple of rungs down\" from the supercell outbreaks we have seen over the past month.", "", "
Troughs moving across the country\u00a0are expected to bring tropical moisture to usually dry regions this week.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "As the system moves east, rain is forecast over central and eastern regions of the eastern states on Thursday, with a few showers lingering into\u00a0Friday.\u00a0", "
The start of a moist couple of weeks
", "Along with the rain, all this tropical moisture is set to make things sticky for the southern states.\u00a0", "\"The moisture coming down from the tropics is quite unusual, especially by the time it gets to Victoria, where we've got 'humid'\u00a0plastered on quite a few different forecasts,\" Mr Browne said.\u00a0", "", "
The forecast sugests most of the country should expect some sort of rainfall over the next eight days.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "The bulk\u00a0of the rain and storms is\u00a0expected to move off from the south-east by the end of the week but the humid, tropical airmass is likely to hang around, encouraging further rainfall.\u00a0", "
Farmers hoping for a dry harvest
", "Mr Browne's predictions are\u00a0not great news for Susan Findlay Tickner, a grain grower in Victoria's Wimmera region,\u00a0just north of Horsham.\u00a0", "A little over a fortnight out from harvest, she is hoping the\u00a0storms manage to avoid her hay.\u00a0", "\"It's kind of touch and go where the rain will fall. Hopefully, it doesn't fall on our hay, which is currently on the ground,\" she said.", "\"If it gets very wet, it will definitely diminish the quality.\"\u00a0", "But rain could be a plus elsewhere.\u00a0", "", "
While a bit more rain could be good for her lentils, Susan is hoping to avoid heavy rain, hail or frost in the fortnight before harvest.\u00a0(Supplied: Susan Findlay Tickner)
", "\"Anything that's still green will benefit from having rain on it,\" Ms Findlay Tickner said.", "\"Quite a few lentils around the district\u00a0still are quite green. So they would benefit from rain.", "Ms Findlay Tickner managed to avoid\u00a0last week's\u00a0hail which caused widespread crop damage.", "But it hasn't all been smooth sailing this season, as a dry August made for a slow start\u00a0and a few\u00a0moderate frost events caused a bit of damage.\u00a0", "\"But despite a lot of nervous anticipation over the last couple of weeks, we actually haven't had the hard-hitting frost that we were quite nervous about,\" she said.\u00a0", "Good finishing rains in September and October\u00a0means Ms Findlay Tickner is hoping to produce an above average yield this season.\u00a0", "Although if things dry up nicely for harvest, that\u00a0would definitely be a bonus.\u00a0", "\"We're very fickle, farmers. We either want rain or we really don't want rain.\"\u00a0"]
